column4: @JeffHicks Published, convert a table of data sent in an email to an array in #PowerShell, copy the table to the clipboard and then use `Read-Clipboard`. Once in PowerShell, you can then convert it to CSV, JSON, or use Export-Excel. `Install-Module -Name ImportExcel` #PSTweetchat

column4: @JeffHicks Using Set-Clipboard PS H:\> $data = @("item1","item2") PS H:\> $data | Set-Clipboard PS H:\> $clipboard = Get-Clipboard PS H:\> $clipboard item1 item2 PS H:\> #PSTweetChat

column4: @JeffHicks PS H:\> $data = @("item1","item2") PS H:\> $data | clip PS H:\> $clip = Get-Clipboard PS H:\> $clip item1 item2 PS H:\> $newclip = (Get-Clipboard) -notlike "" PS H:\> $newclip item1 item2 PS H:\> #PSTweetChat
